definition: one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
gap/to separate/to thin out (seedlings)/to sow discontent
between/among/within a definite time or space/room/section of a room or lateral space between two pairs of pillars/classifier for rooms
in the first moments (of sth happening)/immediately (after an event)/first thing

sentences.english: Scientists say that working the body and mind at the same time revitalizes brain cells.
sentences.chinese: 科学家说，工作在同一时间，身体和精神赋活脑细胞。

sentences.english: And in the same time, Hainan Special Economic Zone was established.
sentences.chinese: 海南经济特区成立于同一时间。

sentences.english: Bigamy lightened the horizon of his shadowy thoughts for a moment.
sentences.chinese: 一时间，在他的思想中模模糊糊闪出了重婚这个念头。

sentences.english: We'll waiting for you tomorrow at the same time.
sentences.chinese: 我们明天同一时间不见不散。

sentences.english: It is difficult to concentrate on more than three things at any one time 48.
sentences.chinese: 人的精力有限，同一时间最多只能干三件事。

sentences.english: Handling more than one sparkler or firework at a time is not safe.
sentences.chinese: 在同一时间处理多个焰火或烟花并不安全。

sentences.english: The boy goes by at about the same time each day,and he is always carrying a bag.
sentences.chinese: 那个男孩每天都在同一时间经过，还总提着一个包。

sentences.english: They like to be on the move and in the same time up-to-date with all the news.
sentences.chinese: 他们喜欢在活动中和在同一时间得到最新以所有新闻。

sentences.english: If start time is defined, the project is scheduled forward from this time.
sentences.chinese: 如果时间起点已定义，专案将从此一时间起向前排程。

sentences.english: Only one target can be hexed at a time. Only works on Humanoids and Beasts.
sentences.chinese: 只有一个目标在同一时间能被巫术。

sentences.english: We see tomorrow at the same time.
sentences.chinese: 让我们明天同一时间不见不散。

sentences.english: I am transfixed by that scene and heartbroken at the same time.
sentences.chinese: 我呆若木鸡由现场和伤心在同一时间。

sentences.english: At the same time all necessaries were dear, and there was no money.
sentences.chinese: 在同一时间所有必需品了亲爱的，没有钱。

sentences.english: Second, I spent some time in teaching my daughter how to work out the mathematics problems.
sentences.chinese: 其次，我花了一时间教我女儿怎样解决数学问题。

sentences.english: Their next tour starts the same time as my holiday does next month.
sentences.chinese: 他们下个旅行团和我下个月的假期在同一时间。

sentences.english: Suddenly the government is sounding self-critical.
sentences.chinese: 一时间，政府似乎做起了自我检讨。

definition: a period of time/a while/for a short while/temporary/momentary/at the same time
in a short while/all at once/all of a sudden
variant of 嘩然|哗然[hua2 ran2]
in uproar/commotion/causing a storm of protest/tumultuous
one after another/in succession/one by one/continuously/diverse/in profusion/numerous and confused/pell-mell
to get round fast/to spread like wildfire
lit. hiding the sky and covering the earth (idiom); fig. earth-shattering/omnipresent/of universal importance
